title: 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as adapted by the Justice and
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 

(Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2022. 

(2) This Order comes into operation at 12 noon on 19 July 2022.

title: 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as adapted by the Justice and
heading: 2. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is
text_raw:
2. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is 

amended - 

(a) 

in Article 2, by the deletion of the definitions of “Convention 
travel document” and “Geneva Convention”, and 

(b) 

in Article 3(b), by the deletion of subparagraph (i). 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Justice, 

18 July, 2022. 

ANDREW MUNRO, 

A person authorised under section 15 of the Ministers and 
Secretaries Act 1924 to authenticate the seal of the 
Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 22nd July, 2022.

title: 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as adapted by the Justice and
heading: (This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014. The Order 
removes the exemption from the requirement to be in possession of a valid 
Irish visa when landing in the State that applied to holders of travel documents 
issued by EU/EEA States under the 1951 Geneva Convention relating to the 
Status of Refugees, where the intended purpose of travel to the State was solely 
for a visit of up to a maximum period of 3 months. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [364]
